intro: Lastrea finisterrae, commonly known as the Canary Islands rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, adapting to the arid conditions of its native habitat. Lastrea finisterrae is notable for its resilience to drought and its role in the unique flora of the Canary Islands.
